We found this very handy because the weather was awful...lots of rain. So we went out between showers and snacked and relaxed at the hotel. reviews.text: I'm tired of listening to Americans complain about European facilities....if you travel overseas, enjoy what European cities have to offer--don't compare it to America! (have lived overseas for 24 years and am loving every minute!)

reviews.text: We stayed here during our trip to Barcelona, and all in all it was a charming B&B, nothing else. The location is very good, close to catalunya square and the Ramblas. We took a bus from the airport to Catalunya square and wheeled our bags a few blocks down to the hotel. Wasn't that bad, just don't carry very heavy bags, as the hotel does not have any bellhop to carry your bags for you and you do have to carry your bags up to the top landing where there is a quaint little pulley to take you upto the main floor. The hotel is very small, must have been an old palazzo residence or made to look like one, as the suite room we stayed in was decorated like a parlor. For 4 people they only have 2 suites which consists of basically a small parlor with 2 roll away beds, a sitting area, and a fireplace, beautifully decorated with gilt mirrors and high ceilings. Leading off this parlor is a small bedroom only big enough to hold a double/queen bed and a small dresser and fridge. Next to the bed is the bathroom which is extremely tight. The room was quaint and looked down onto the street which was quite busy even late in the night. Right next to the suite room was the common dining area, where one can have coffee, tea, sodas and snacks all day long. there were 3 tiny balconies with tables also looking out onto the street, for a blissful morning cuppa. A word of advise, don't expect much in terms of food. It is just a breakfast bar with some snacks throughout the day. The menu never changed, but included egg omelets, boiled,egg quiches, some kind of salads, different dried nuts, cereals, fruits, yogurts,milk, tea, coffee, soft drinks, water and juice. There are only 2 or people working here, one at the front desk, one in the little kitchen behind the snack bar and maybe a maintenance person. Couldn't really complain. Except that when we were back home we got an unexpected high charge on our credit card from them, which after investigating was for broken down air conditioning which was not even our doing. so a word of caution- never give out info about 2 cards.
reviews.title: Quaint and charming, Bed and breakfast in a palazzo.

reviews.text: One can walk down all the way down the Ramblas to the waterfront and the Columbus monument. Plus it was a block turn away from Casa Battlo and La Pedrera, Antonio Gaudi's famous residences. Down the Ramblas one can divert to the Barri Gottic neighborhood. The Ramblas is lined with tapas/Paella bars, restaurants and roadside entertainment.
reviews.title: Great service, claustrophobic room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is also close to the red and blue bus lines which is a very convenient way to see Barcelona, and the stops are close to the hotel or get down at Plaza catalunya which is 2 blocks from the hotel. we walked quite a bit down the side streets and main roads to explore. It was just 25 mins away from the airport as well.
reviews.title: A Letdown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all Barcelona is a fantastic city made so by Gaudi's marvelous designs and a vibrant city on its own as well, with beautiful beaches and nightlife.
reviews.title: Are you kidding?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once I got over the claustrophobia of my room, I truly enjoyed this hotel. The public sitting area is nice and the buffet came in very handy. Above all the service was excellent. Vivianne took great care of us.
reviews.title: Perfect for City sightseeing

reviews.text: We were a group of 5 ladies from 18-62, We had a lovely suite with 2 beds in one room and 3 cots in the Versaille Lounge. The location is wonderful and the decor makes you truly feel like a princess. The staff was great - Thanks Christina, Vivienne and Schukot (?) The buffet was a nice bonus with coffee, snacks, wine and beer. We would definitely come back!
reviews.title: Special Place for a special trip !

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days in late June before our Disney cruise. We chose this place based on the reviews and were not disappointed. The service was great, the people were friendly and the free wine and beer didn't hurt. We had a wonderful quirky room full of charm and light (#137?). Lots of old fashioned touches and a great balcony right on the street. There was nothing better than coming in after a day of sightseeing and relaxing in the salon with a refreshment. Lots of great European ambiance. This is a hotel with old style European charm and unique features. Definately not your standard, sterile 12 x 12 modern hotel room. We would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Great PLace to Relax and People Watch

reviews.text: We loved this hotel!! We stayed at 4 hotels in the last 3 weeks and this was our very favorite!! We stayed here for 3 nites prior to our cruise and the location is perfect!! It is a easy 3 block walk to Las Rambles, we visited friends who were staying at their sister facility Continental but I loved this one. It has good location but not the noise of staying on Las Rambles.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel - best of our trip!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a beautiful restored 1800's mansion that used to be a private home, they only have 19 rooms but it so full of charm and elegance! Beautiful chandiliers, mirrors, crown moldings, and fireplaces. Typical small european rooms but we were luckily upgraded to their suite due to 3 in our family, we loved it!! We enjoyed their breakfasts and 24 hr available drinks and snacks. Great to relax with a small snack and drink after a day of sightseeing before heading out again! The staff was so warm and helpful with sightseeing and restaurant recommendations. Lovely gelato across the street and 2 great nearby tapa bars that were fabulous. The staff held our luggage for us the morning we returned from our cruise until late afternoon for no charge so we could see more of Barcelona before we went to the airport. We can only hope to return to this hotel in the future! I highly recommend it and thank the very kind staff.
reviews.title: Good value, excellent location
Dishonest hotel!!!! URGE ALL TO AVOID!!!!
reviews.text: We found the staff very friendly and accommodating. The room was very nice and the 24 hr buffet certainly helped keep our food costs down while visiting in Barcelona. The staff took care of our luggage for us after we checked out because we had time before catching a train. The taxi stand just across the street was convenient. The hotel is very well situated. I would stay at this hotel again and recommend to friends and family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely funky. The location is good, just a block north of the Placa Catalunya, but the amenities are quirky. It is all about self service -- there are no porters or anybody to help with luggage, and while the staff is friendly, they don't go out of their way to help. The room was comfortable and clean. Ours had an interior balcony, I guess for smoking, but it was tiny and fully enclosed, so it had no view at all. The hotel advertises wifi service, but the signal is too weak to be usable in the rooms. It does work in the common salon, which is an atractive room with real balconies. The big selling point is supposed to be the 24 hour food buffet. It is good for beverages and breakfast, but you would not really want to count on it for your main meals. One fellow traveler, Sneezy McGrazer, seemed to enjoy it. The food gets overcooked and stale, despite the efforts of the staff.
reviews.title: Overrated buffet

reviews.text: We loved staying at this hotel. It's right off of the plaza del sol, so it's centrally located. Also, the 24hr buffet was great. We spent many a late night grabbing snacks. It was also great to grab a bottle of water before sight seeing. The staff were incredubly helpful. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. Although I would get a larger room.
reviews.title: Little Pink Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for six nights the last week of April and would have loved the hotel if not for being unable to book or upgrade to an exterior room. All of the previous reviews accurately expound on the wonderful features of the property, including the extensive convenience and value of the buffet, the beautiful sitting/dining room, the helpfulness of the staff, and the excellent location.
reviews.title: Great hotel unless you have interior room

likes.liked: — sitting room, buffet, staff assistance and help
likes.disliked: — the size, and ambience of the room

reviews.text: Prior to booking I read reviews that warned that interior rooms should be avoided. I should have heeded the reviews and booked another hotel when I was told that none of the exterior rooms were available. There was absolutely no problem with noise (as stated in some reviews). The beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms were very good by European standards. But when the rooms are described as small, this isn't just small by European standards. Our room literally only fit the bed and two tiny plastic nightstands (the room was equipped with a king size bed----it would have been better with a full). Although there is a "patio", it doesn't provide much more space, light or air as the patio is more of a boxed-in cell---no view, no window, no air.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.text: We were just staying one night pre-cruise and booked the Palacete the last minute before departing Canada. What a gem! After two weeks of 3 star hotels in Europe, we weren't expecting too much. The Palacete was far and away the best hotel we stayed in!
reviews.title: It's all good!

likes.liked: — Really friendly staff, great buffet, comfortable room

reviews.title: Very nice
reviews.text: The decor is decidedly feminine, but not as over-the-top as I was expecting. The room was very comfortable: good beds (got a triple), good air conditioning, and the bathroom was spacious and clean with a decent sized bathtub and a bidet as well as toilet, sink, shower. We also had our own minifridge and microwave, although the offerings in the buffet made it unnecessary to hoard away our own breakfast/lunch foods.
Ah, the buffet! What a pleasant surprise! Hot foods, fresh fruit, nuts, sweets, a cappucino/espresso machine...even fresh lemon thoughtfully provided for your tea!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: There are two computer terminals where you can access the internet free. The breakfast room is very lovely and has small balcony tables as well as larger ones inside the room. The Ramblas starts about a block away (must say that was a disappointment after all the postings...just a hoard of tourists on a pedestrian boulevard with some mimes and a few folks selling live birds and goldfish) so we had no problem at all with noise coming into the room.
reviews.title: a gem!
5 night
reviews.text: My one reservation...you do have to lug your bags up a short flight of stairs off the street to reach the teeny tiny elevator that will take you to the lobby proper. The elevator was a hair-raising experience for me...when we checked out I just put my bags in it and met them downstairs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: See also my review of The Hotel Continental which is the sister hotel to this one for details of location, amenities, etc.. We stayed in both hotels over our extended 17 day/16 night trip in Spain. 3 nights at The Continental & 11 nights at The Palacete. Our original plans were changed (to say the least) since I was in the hospital in Barcelona for the last 8 days of our trip. This is where the wonderful staff went above and beyond, finding room in the booked hotel for my husband as our stay was continually extended (my husband had to change our flight home 4 times). They even moved the bags for him (they were already packed of course) when room changes needed to be made! They also were concerned about how I was doing and even sent me flowers at the hospital! It was such a relief for my husband to at least not have to worry about his lodging on top of everything else!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful staff!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you, thank you Palacete!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay-fantastic staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the location-very convenient to transportation and activities. The front desk personel were very helpful with any questions or requests we had. The buffet is a very nice feature-I love being able to get coffee or a snack whenever we wanted and the men in our group loved coming back from an outing and having a glass of wine before beginning the evening-and all included in the buffet!! They also make a chocolate candy that we looked forward to every day! Would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: It's all true, and our stay was wonderful...

reviews.text: I've been reading others' reviews and they're all true in some ways. There must be a big variety in room confitgurations. Ours was a "Sun" room overlooking Rambla Catalunya, lovely view of the square below and really quiet, not huge but certainly ample space for a couple. We'd be in the "24/7 buffet was a great thing" camp. It's true it changed little over our 4 nights, but did have a good balance of cold (cereals, breads, excellent fruits) and hot or heatable (chicken, eggs, rice, pasta), and a few daily hot souffles and such. Certainly wouldn't want to take all our meals there, but terrific at odd hours when you just want a snack without negotiating the tapas scene. We also liked the decor very much, including the elegant dining/sitting area.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: Desk staff were super helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent Service- Great Location

reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Hotel Continental Palacete. Great location, nearly all the sites within walking distance, old world charm, free drinks and buffet (delicious fresh fruit), free internet, quiet rooms, great restaurants within a block, friendly staff. We will definatly stay there again.
reviews.title: Best location in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked five months ahead of time to stay in in upscale hotel in Barcelona. When we go there the rest of the place was booked with teenagers from Canada. While the teenagers were polite, they still were a group of teenagers stomping around and slamming doors. Our requested "quiet room" just happened to be under the stairs. If I wanted to stay in a hostel, I would have booked that. We did not get much sleep. For a 19 room place, there were cots in rooms and 25-30 with that group. I feel that management should have given us the warning before hand so we could have booked elsewhere or at a sister hotel. I feel that the management made poor decision making with this and if they want to have upscale clients, they need to cater to this population and not to young groups. Even well behaved teenagers are still teenagers. The discount they gave us did not make up for poor sleep and experiences on the last two days of our vacation.
reviews.title: I would never return to this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night before our Mediterranean cruise. We went to the hotel directly from the airport arriving around 11AM. They had a room ready for us by 12:30. Yampalin described this hotel perfectly in his or her review. We couldn't have been more pleased with the wonderful staff and great location. Loved the decor! The 24 hr buffet foods was certainly adequate.
reviews.title: Great hotel staff, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been in Barcelona many times with my wife at three different hotels, all very good and worthwhile (two Best Westerns and Comtes de Barcelona), decided this time to try smaller independent hotels, so searched the entire city center using Venere and gtahotels listings and maps, until finally deciding on Contiental Palacete, a small family hotel in one the choiciest sectors of the Ramblas Catalunya.
reviews.title: For those who appreciate comfort, elegance and tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel may be viewed in detail on its own website, showing pictures which faithfully reflect reality. The rooms are of three sizes, we took a mid sized room (137), with a closed balcony on the Ramblas Catalunya street, very well protected from the noise.
reviews.title: Location location location!

reviews.text: Barcelona was our first stop in a 16-day Spain itinerary, and the Hotel Continental Palacete was the perfect way to start the experience. Convenient location, helpful desk staff, free internet, but the two things that stand out are free food (nice variety of food in a cold buffet at all hours, plus beverages and wine on tap, even at breakfast) and a lovely salon in which to eat the free food! Since we were traveling with another couple, the salon became our living room. And what a room! Opulent and extravagantly gilded (the hotel was once an elegant residence), with French doors opening to a lovely view of the street scene below.
reviews.title: The perfect place for travelers coming to Barcelona

reviews.text: Our room was also overdone, but since it was really small the result was charming in a funky way. We had an interior room because I was concerned about noise, but the neighborhood was fairly quiet, so don't hesitate to get an outside room.
reviews.title: Quaint and quirky!

likes.liked: — The magnificent decor in the public rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you arrive with your luggage, look for the self-operated elevator just to the right of the stairway.
reviews.title: Perfect Location & Good Value

likes.liked: — Elegant Antique Palace converted into a small Inn. Great location. Great value including the 24 hr. buffet/refreshments.
likes.disliked: — Electrical system ! Key on a slate. You had only one and had to turn it into the desk clerk.

reviews.text: We stayed at this very quaint small hotel in July 2007. We booked the Versailles Salon which consisted of a magnificent private sitting room decorated in French Rococo style and a fairly small and VERY pink bedroom, which was scrupulously clean.
reviews.title: value for money.

likes.liked: — staff and free food and drink and a lovely balcony to sit on and location
likes.disliked: — having to take luggage up steps

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a magnificent breakfast room with balconies overlooking the square where you can relax and watch the world go by. The staff all speak English and are very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Positive: A great location and the buffet comes in handy for a snack and for breakfast. The lounge area is nice and has balconies that you can sit and watch the street life. They have free internet in the lobby which is convenient too. Negative: The decor is very over the top and if you love hot pink then this is your place. We orginally got a interior room which was not acceptable, way too small for 2 people with luggage and it smelled. We upgraded to the Tribune Suite so that we would be more comfortable, so we thought. The bed was the MOST uncomfortable bed that I had ever slept on. I asked the hotel and all the beds are the same so we could not switch rooms again. Thank god we only stayed two nights here and we wont be back again.
reviews.title: Beds are hard as a rock!

description: Small hotel. Best location in Barcelona on las Ramblas. Rooms perfectly equipped. All day buffet, soft drinks, internet and wi-fi access for free.
